Return to Learn Plan-Westwood Heights Schools

As we prepare for a new school year under a cloud of uncertainty, we want you to know that our school district will accommodate whichever form of learning your family chooses. While the risk of serious illness from Covid-19 is low among our student population, we recognize that you must consider many factors in your decision. Are there vulnerable family members in the home? How will my student tolerate wearing a mask most of the day? How do we keep our student from falling behind in their education?

Regardless of your decision, be assured that we will do everything in our power to keep your student safe and on track with their education. This letter is an attempt to explain the steps we are taking to reopen safely and the rationale behind them. Events may force us to change course in the coming months, and we appreciate your patience as we work through these difficult times.

Read the full plan below.

Hamady Middle/High School introduces their new food pantry called the Hawk's Aerie. Students will now have access to free groceries and personal items for their families. The pantry features several dinner combinations, cereals, energy bars, drinks, and snack items. Refrigerated items will be added later in the year. Honor Society and Student Council members will operate the pantry.

This pantry is part of our Best Food Foward partnership that focuses on helping to connect students with the healthy food they need for success. The program intends to improve the way students learn, engage, and eat at school and home. By making healthy food accessible to students and their families, we are improving the way schools and communities work together.

The Hawk's Aerie hours are Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 7:15 am to 7:30 am and 2:30 pm to 3:00 pm.

#hawknation #WeAreWestwoodHeights
